reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there one night for a concert. Great location if you want to walk to events at twickenham. Otherwise I would not stay here. The place was just dirty (room and restaurant). It needs a good solid cleaning with a bucket of soap and water. While having my breakfast, I could see the thick dust and dirt behind the curtain. The poor plant on the shelf was in desperate need of water. The room was OK but not worth the price. The bed linens (if you call them that) were well worn. Walls and bathroom were just dirty. I didn't want to touch the blankets on the bed for fear of when they were last washed. This place could be nice..... just need someone to teach the staff how to clean.
reviews.title: Friendly Service, but needs a good cleaning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights (rugby weekend) friday and saturday, we arrived at 12pm and were able to get our room straight away (check ins not til 2pm). We were on the 2nd floor overlooking the main road, and it was really quiet as the room had air con so no need to open the window, the room was big and had a lovely bathroom, the hotel was really clean and the staff were great. The breakfast in the morning was enough to fill any belly and set you up for the day.
reviews.title: great
Excellent Service
reviews.text: Turn left out of the hotel and you are a 3-5 min walk from the centre of town. At the end of the road if you cross over and turn left there is a great chinese reataurant called Jun Ming, the food is great.

reviews.title: The food is awful
reviews.text: We will be staying at this hotel again!!!!

reviews.title: Rugby fans stay here!
reviews.text: Very friendly and helpful staff. Food very good (particularly the fish dishes). Very clean. Recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a night at this hotel. The room was very comfortable quite spacious. We had a meal for 8 at the restaurant and all of us had excellent food. Staff were very attentive.
reviews.title: Loved the Grotto

reviews.text: I stayed here whilst on business due to the location.
reviews.title: Pretty damned good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Approx 30 mins from Heathrow by cab £27.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
Good Enough
reviews.text: This is a nice English pub with good basic food and good beer. The atmosphere is very nice as well. During the summer I would expect this place to be very busy as it is just on the Thames river.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night for a wedding. Overall a nice hotel but could do with redecorating in some areas. In a good location with ample car parking facilities. Located in a quiet residential area only a ten minute walk from the high street shops and York House.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in good location - could do with redeocrating

reviews.text: Rooms are a decent size with a good size bathroom and little treats. No fridge or safe which would be useful. Had tea/Coffee making facilities and iron and ironing board/trouser press. Large spacious wardrobe.
reviews.title: Bit more grotty than grotto

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was very clean. Lift access too.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast area a bit dismal, could do with a little brightening up. Breakfast was a selection of pastries/cereals/toast/fruit. Tea, coffee and fruit tea. Full cooked breakfast was quite pricey over £7.00.
reviews.title: A little gem

likes.disliked: — Roadside position creates disappointing first impression
